bill.title: Senate Substitute for HB 2416 by Committee on Judiciary – Requiring compensation for the use, restriction on use, damage, loss or destruction of property as a result of certain governmental actions, authorizing reimbursement of property taxes levied upon businesses shut down or restricted as a result of certain governmental actions related to contagious or infectious disease in humans and establishing the COVID-19 retail storefront property tax relief act to provide partial refunds to certain businesses impacted by COVID-19-related shutdowns and restrictions.
bill.description: Senate Substitute for HB 2416 by Committee on Judiciary – Requiring compensation for the use, restriction on use, damage, loss or destruction of property as a result of certain governmental actions, authorizing reimbursement of property taxes levied upon businesses shut down or restricted as a result of certain governmental actions related to contagious or infectious disease in humans and establishing the COVID-19 retail storefront property tax relief act to provide partial refunds to certain businesses impacted by COVID-19-related shutdowns and restrictions.

history.action: House Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Judiciary
House Hearing: Wednesday, February 24, 2021, 3:30 PM Room 582-N
House Hearing continuation: Thursday, February 25, 2021, 3:30 PM Room 582-N
House Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Judiciary
House Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Highberger
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Highberger was rejected
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Kuether
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Kuether was rejected
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Curtis
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Curtis was rejected
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Ohaebosim
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Ohaebosim was rejected
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Probst
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Probst was rejected
House Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
House Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 81 Nay: 40
House Engrossed on Friday, March 5, 2021
Senate Received and Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Judiciary
Senate Committee Report recommending substitute bill be passed by Committee on Judiciary
Senate Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted recommending substitute bill be passed
Senate Motion to divide the question; Part 1 retained.
Senate Motion to divide the question; Part 2 rejected.
Senate Committee of the Whole - Passed over and retain a place on the calendar
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Warren
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Warren was adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Tyson
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Tyson was withdrawn
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Baumgardner
Senate  Senator Pittman raised a question of germaneness. The amendment was ruled germane.
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Baumgardner was adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Tyson
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Tyson was adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Substitute bill be passed as amended
Senate Emergency Final Action - Substitute passed as amended;  Yea: 26 Nay: 11
House Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed Representative Smith, A. , Representative Highland and Representative Gartner as conferees
Senate Motion to accede adopted;  Senator Warren,  Senator Wilborn and  Senator Corson appointed as conferees
House  Representative Mason is appointed to replace  Representative Highland on the Conference Committee
House Died in Conference

votes.desc: House Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 81 Nay: 40
Senate Emergency Final Action - Substitute passed as amended - Yea: 26 Nay: 11
